articles.author: ED WHITE
articles.description: PONTIAC, Mich. (AP) — A judge sentenced the parents of a Michigan school shooter to at least 10 years in prison Tuesday for failing to take steps that could have prevented a “runaway train” — the killing of four students in 2021.
articles.title: Michigan school shooter's parents sentenced to at least 10 years in prison

articles.author: JENNIFER PELTZ and MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A New York appeals court judge Tuesday rejected former President Donald Trump’s latest bid to delay his hush money criminal trial while he fights a gag order.
articles.title: Appeals court rejects Donald Trump's latest attempt to delay April 15 hush money criminal trial

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has escalated his pledge to invade the southern Gaza city of Rafah, saying a date has been set for the ground offensive into the city filled with around 1.4 million Palestinians, most of whom are displaced from other parts of the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: The Latest | Netanyahu vows to carry out Rafah invasion, which US says would be a mistake

articles.author: MOLLY QUELL and RAF CASERT
articles.description: STRASBOURG, France (AP) — Europe’s highest human rights court ruled Tuesday that countries must better protect their people from the consequences of climate change, siding with a group of older Swiss women against their government in a landmark ruling that could have implications across the continent.
articles.title: Verdict saying Switzerland violated rights by failing on climate action could ripple across Europe

articles.author: JONEL ALECCIA
articles.description: The federal program that helps pay for groceries for millions of low-income mothers, babies and young kids will soon emphasize more fruits, vegetables and whole grains, as well as provide a wider choice of foods from different cultures.
articles.title: New WIC rules include more money for fruits and veggies. They also expand food choices

articles.author: LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Hard-right Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene is escalating her criticism of House Speaker Mike Johnson, blistering his leadership in a lengthy letter to colleagues and renewing threats of a snap vote that could remove him from office.
articles.title: GOP's Marjorie Taylor Greene delivers fresh threats of ousting Speaker Johnson in scathing rebuke

articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Nobel prize-winning physicist Peter Higgs, who proposed the existence of the so-called “God particle” that helped explain how matter formed after the Big Bang, has died at age 94, the University of Edinburgh said Tuesday.
articles.title: Peter Higgs, who proposed existence of Higgs boson particle, has died at 94, university says

articles.author: TARA COPP and LOLITA C. BALDOR
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin told Congress Tuesday that pressure on Israel to improve humanitarian aid to Gaza appears to be working, but he said more must be done, and it remains to be seen if the improvement will continue.
articles.title: Austin tells Congress Israel is taking steps to boost aid to Gaza as lawmakers question US support

articles.author: MATTHEW DALY
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — More than 200 chemical plants nationwide will be required to reduce toxic emissions that are likely to cause cancer under a new rule issued Tuesday by the Environmental Protection Agency.
articles.title: New EPA rule says 218 US chemical plants must reduce toxic emissions that are likely to cause cancer

articles.author: HILLEL ITALIE and KIMBERLEE KRUESI
articles.description: When an illustrated edition of Margaret Atwood’s “The Handmaid’s Tale” was released in 2019, educators in Clayton, Missouri needed little debate before deciding to keep copies in high school libraries.
articles.title: Librarians fear new penalties, even prison, as activists challenge books
